outline: Rob was upset about some things the city council was doing.
Rob was against them instituting permit parking on Rob's street.
Ruffles walked out.

responses:
Plan:
Rob is a man who is upset about some things the city council is doing, specifically, he is against the implementation of permit parking on his street. He decides to take action by speaking out at several city council meetings. One day, Ruffles, Rob's dog, walks out of the house and goes missing. While searching for Ruffles, Rob stumbles upon a group of people planning to protest the permit parking. Rob joins the protest and is ultimately able to prevent the measure from being implemented.

Story:
Rob had always been an active member of his community, attending city council meetings and speaking out on issues that mattered to him. However, recently, the city council had been making decisions that Rob strongly disagreed with. The latest decision was to implement permit parking on Rob's street, a decision that he found particularly troublesome.

Rob knew that he had to take action, so he started attending several city council meetings to voice his concerns. He spoke passionately about how the permit parking would negatively impact the community and how it would be a financial burden for residents. However, despite Rob's efforts, the city council seemed determined to move forward with the plan.

One day, Rob's beloved dog Ruffles walked out of the house and went missing. Rob searched the neighborhood for hours, calling out Ruffles' name. As he was walking down the street, he stumbled upon a group of people who were planning to protest the permit parking.

Rob joined the protest and found that he wasn't alone in his concerns. Many others shared his frustration with the city council's decision. The protest was peaceful but powerful, and it caught the attention of local media outlets.

As a result of the protest, the city council was forced to reconsider their decision. Rob continued to speak out at council meetings, urging them to listen to the community's concerns. Finally, after several months of rallying and protesting, the city council decided to abandon the permit parking plan.

Rob was relieved and grateful that he and his community had been able to make a difference. He knew that it was important to speak out against decisions that could negatively impact the community, and he was proud to have been a part of the movement that prevented the permit parking from being implemented. And, of course, he was overjoyed when Ruffles finally came home.

outline: Sam saw his brother Barry eating a peanut butter and banana sandwich.

responses:

Story:
Sam had always been a picky eater. He stuck to the basics - pizza, burgers, and fries. So when he saw his brother Barry eating a peanut butter and banana sandwich, his stomach churned. He wrinkled his nose and said, "That's the grossest thing I've ever seen."

Barry just shrugged and continued eating. Sam couldn't understand how anyone could enjoy something like that. The thought of it made him feel sick.

Meanwhile, Holly was in her senior year of college and busy applying to graduate schools. She spent hours researching different programs, trying to figure out which one would be the best fit for her.

One day, Sam was sitting in the kitchen, staring at the peanut butter jar. He knew he should try it, just to see what all the fuss was about. But the thought of combining it with bananas made him want to gag.

After weeks of Barry and Holly pestering him, Sam finally gave in. "Fine," he said, reluctantly taking a bite of the sandwich. To his surprise, it wasn't half bad. In fact, it was pretty good.

Before he knew it, Sam was eating peanut butter and banana sandwiches every week. He couldn't believe he had been missing out on something so delicious for so long. As for Holly, she eventually got into her top choice graduate school and started a successful career in her field.

Looking back, Sam realized that sometimes it takes trying something new to discover something great. And he was glad that he had given the peanut butter and banana sandwich a chance.

As she walked into the pub, she could feel her nerves jangling. Her coworkers welcomed her warmly, and they all ordered beer. Cindy hesitated, wondering if she should order a soft drink instead. However, she decided to go with the flow and ordered a beer like her colleagues.

As they sat and chatted, Nellie suddenly burst out laughing. Cindy turned to her and saw that Nellie was covered head-to-toe in heavy wet sand. Nellie explained that she had gone to the beach earlier in the day, and a wave had caught her off-guard, soaking her with sand.

Tom had always been an ardent supporter of the Second Amendment. He believed that owning a gun was a fundamental right and that everyone should have one. So, when he decided to buy a gun, he was thrilled. He went to a gun shop, eager to make his purchase.

It was then that he started to rethink his gun culture. He realized that owning a gun wasn't just a right; it was a responsibility.
